author: S Bhuvaneshwari
text:
A 25-year-old man has been arrested for forcing a couple to strip at Siddarabetta in the Koratagere taluk of Tumakuru district recently.

The accused, Bheemaraju, is a resident of Aregujjanahalli in Tumakuru district, and works as a cleaner of a private bus.

Inspector-General of Police of Central Range Arun Chakravarthy told reporters that the accused confessed to forcing the couple to disrobe by threatening them that he had taken their pictures and could arrest them for indulging in “illegal activities”. He had taken away their mobile phones and the woman’s bag. The police tracked him after he used the woman’s mobile phone to call his sister at Aregujjanahalli.

He was arrested at Madhugiri while trying to board a bus to Pavagada.

Mr. Chakravarthy said Bheemaraju forced the couple to undress to ensure that they could neither follow him nor seek help from the public. The police have recovered the two phones and the woman’s bag from him.

The police said Bheemaraju tried to rape the woman at a secluded place. But she kicked him and tried to escape.

He caught hold of her and pushed her from a rock. After hiding in the forest the whole night, the woman sought help of villagers at Bandehalli, who gave her clothes.

Bheemaraju was traced by the police when he made a call using the woman’s phone
title: Bus cleaner held for forcing couple to strip in Karnataka forest
